page.title: 03ECOLOGY OF THE TADLEY AREA
page.content: The influence of geology on ecology and landuse in the Tadley area is very marked and has led to the quite distinct division of rural and urban areas. The London CLay and Alluvial gravels have been largely converted to intensive agricultural systems. On the Bagshot Beds woodland high forest, mainly of oaks with alder in the wetter patches, has developed, some of these area have been put into timber production. On the Plateau gravels good examples of heathland with typical plant and animal communities are regarded as poor agricultural land and have been allowed to become light industrial and housing land, although some areas of common land remain. Gravel extraction has been a major feature of the area, but at present there is very little within the survey area.
